venue.name: Hammond Campus Center, Fitchburg State University (Ellis White Lecture Hall)

item.description:
Let's go see The Colors of the Mountain, a Colombian film being shown at Fitchburg State University in the Ellis White Lecture Hall (Hammond Campus Center) 160 Pearl Street on Wednesday, September 19th. Tickets are $7 adults, $5 students at the door. The film is being shown at 3:30pm and 7:00pm.

The film, by Carlos César Arbeláez, debuted in 2010 and garnered international recognition and awards. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1715853/


A modern-day portrayal of daily life in a remote part of the mountainous Colombian countryside is set around the friendship between Manuel and Julián. One day, while playing a game of football, they kick the ball into a minefield. Accompanied by another friend, Poca Luz, they do everything they can to recover their prized possession, an essential part of their everyday lives and dreams. In Spanish with English subtitles, 88 min.

We're meeting for dinner at 5:30 at the Panera on Gold Star Blvd near Harr Dodge; we'll leave from there at 6:30 to get to the show in Fitchburg.
